newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul exchange halts trading in Hanil.
newsitem.headline: Seoul exchange halts trading in Hanil.

text.p: The Korea Stock Exchange said it has ordered a trading suspension in the shares of Hanil Textile Co Ltd for Tuesday due to the company's deteriorating financial status.
The exchange said in a statement that trading would resume from Wednesday under strict bourse supervision.
The statement said total liabilities for Hanil Textile have exceeded the company's capital for the past three years due to mounting debts.
Hanil shares are expected to delisted on September 30, 1999 unless its financial situation improves, it said.
Shares of Hanil Textile, a cotton textile company, closed on Monday at 6,890 won.
